intro: Mariscus praelongatus, commonly known as the long-stemmed mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes well-known genera such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Mariscus praelongatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
